Curator's comments: Bibliography: The British Museum, Guide to the fourth, fifth and sixth Egyptian rooms, and to the Coptic room (London, 1922), 25 (cited erroneously as one of 43370-2); G Roeder, Ägyptische Bronzefiguren (Berlin, 1956), 317 (400, d), Abb 408; T G H James, Egyptian Sculptures (1966), pl. 30; T G H James and W V Davies, Egyptian Sculpture (London, 1983), 52-3, 66; A Oddy, P Pearce and L Green, ‘An unusual gilding technique on some Egyptian bronzes’, in S C Watkins and C E Brown (eds), Conservation of Ancient Egyptian Materials (London, 1988), 36, figs 1, 2; M J Raven, ‘The Lady of Leiden. A monumental bronze figure and its restoration’, in L Limme and J Strybol (eds), Aegyptus Museis Rediviva. Miscellanea in honorem Hermanni de Meulenaere (Brussels, 1993), 133; T G H James, A Short History of Ancient Egypt (Cairo, 1995), fig on 127; J Taylor, P Craddock and F Shearman, ‘Egyptian hollow-cast bronze statues of the early first millennium BC: the development of a new technology, Apollo cxlviii (no. 437, new series) (July 1998), 9-14, figs. 1, 7; E Delange, A di Mantova and J H Taylor, ‘Un bronze Egyptien meconnu’, La Revue du Louvre xlviii (5) (1998), 72-3, fig 12; J Malek, Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Statues, Reliefs and Paintings, VIII, 2 (Oxford, 1999), 751-2 (801-715-752); J H Taylor in M Hill (ed), Gifts for the Gods. Images from Egyptian Temples (New York, 2007), 95-97.
Bibliographic references: McArthur et al 2015 / The conservation and technical investigation of a hollow-cast Egyptian bronze (p.111, p.112, p.113)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2007-2008 15 Oct-17 Feb, New York, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Gifts of the Gods
